author: Vijaykumar Patil
text:
The Maharashtra government has agreed to release 2 tmcft of water from its Koyna and Kalammawadi reservoirs across the Krishna and Dudhganga to meet the drinking water needs of the districts in north Karnataka reeling under drought conditions. The water will be released in two instalments of one tmcft each in the first weeks of April and May.

Former Minister Prakash B. Hukkeri recently met the Maharashtra Minister for Water Resources and conveyed Karnataka’s request for release of 4 tmcft of water, of which the latter agreed to release 2 tmcft.
title: Maharashtra to release 2 tmcft water
